cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

The paper focuses on mining and analyzing future works in scientific articles, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques. The paper dataset used in the study is from the computer science field, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to one of the sub-categories in CS. The regular expression based method proposed in the paper is commonly used in natural language processing tasks, such as text extraction and pattern matching, which is relevant to sub-categories such as cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The multi-class classification problem investigated in the paper is a typical machine learning task, which is relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The prototype system designed in the paper is likely to involve deep learning techniques, which is relevant to sub-category cs.DL (Deep Learning). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.DL.
